member_organisations:
The ERCIM membership is at 
  http://www.ercim.eu/about/members 
and also, when talking about W3C, we need to account for the W3C members in Europe (subset of 
https://www.w3.org/Consortium/Member/List)
fields_of_interest: Research and innovation, Digital economy and society, Communication
eu_initiatives:
ERCIM is following the DG CNECT framework program since it coordinates projects with its member. 
ERCIM/W3C is participating in the EC Multistakeholder platform for ICT Standardization and is tracking many aspects of technical policy development related to the Internet and the Web in Europe (e.g debate on Open Standard, PSI, Open Data, Accessibility, etc).
organisation_name: European Research Consortium for Informatics and Mathematics (ERCIM)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Web Accessibility Directive Expert Group#E03475#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3475#Not a member#C#SUB-GROUP OF THE WEB ACCESSIBILITY DIRECTIVE EXPERT GROUP
membership: ERCIM is the host of W3C for Europe (W3C can be considered a federation of hosts, the 3 others being USA/MIT, Japan/Keio, and China/Beijang)
goals__remit:
The main objective of ERCIM is to contribute to a leading role of Europe in ICT: 
 
    by building a European-wide, open network of centres of excellence in ICT 
    by excelling in research and by acting as a bridge to applications 
    by being internationally recognized as a major representative organisation in its field; the portal which gives access to all relevant ICT research groups in Europe 
    by acting as an interface for the non-EU member institutions within the European Community and other international organisations 
    by cooperating with other international organisations in its field 
    by promoting cooperation in research, technology transfer, innovation and training 
 
Thus creating added value for its members, for their countries and for Europe. 
 
In addition, ERCIM is the host of W3C Europe (World Wide Web Consortium, main standardization body for the Web)
